alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 6:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of slow moving thunderstorms with torrential rain extending from just east of Pringletown to Moncks Corner and Old Cordesville. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have already fallen in some areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moncks Corner, Ridgeville, Pinopolis, Old Santee Canal State Park, Murraysville, Whitesville, Sugar Hill, Berkeley County Airport, Saint Johns, Chicora, Oakley, New Hope, Stony Landing, Simpson Crossing, Macbeth, Wadboo, Mepkin, Hussertown, Ellwood and Old Cordesville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
